intro: Harpaecarpus minimus, commonly known as the small-fruited harpaecarpus, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and unique inflorescence structure. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. Its growth habit is typically low and mat-forming, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
